publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3780.2 Shiona Baird: Christmas Card Recycling Scheme—As an amendment to motion (S2M-3780) in the name of Pauline McNeill, insert at end “but expresses regret that a proportion of the cards so collected will be shipped to China for recycling; therefore encourages people to make use of their dedicated local recycling facilities, wherever possible, so that their cards can be recycled locally, and calls on the Scottish Executive urgently to ensure that Scotland’s recycling facilities are expanded and improved in order to uphold the proximity principle and eliminate the need for the long-distance transportation of materials for recycling.” Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-3780.2 Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 9 January 2006) Eleanor Scott*, Ms Sandra White*, Rob Gibson*, Chris Ballance*, Mark Ballard*, Patrick Harvie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Rosie Kane*, Robin Harper*, Frances Curran*

S2M-3780.2 Shiona Baird: Christmas Card Recycling Scheme—As an amendment to motion (S2M-3780) in the name of Pauline McNeill, insert at end “but expresses regret that a proportion of the cards so collected will be shipped to China for recycling; therefore encourages people to make use of their dedicated local recycling facilities, wherever possible, so that their cards can be recycled locally, and calls on the Scottish Executive urgently to ensure that Scotland’s recycling facilities are expanded and improved in order to uphold the proximity principle and eliminate the need for the long-distance transportation of materials for recycling.” Supported by: Eleanor Scott, Ms Sandra White, Rob Gibson, Chris Ballance, Mark Ballard, Patrick Harvie, Tommy Sheridan, Rosie Kane, Robin Harper, Frances Curran
S2M-3780.2 Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 9 January 2006) Mr Adam Ingram*
